Posts.Content: Looking at other discussions, I did forget about the effect of Taxotere on my arthritis (osteo). It was tough, but dr. changed my arthritis med and gave me pain pills. I now use Tylenol ES for the pain, which has receded to pre-chemo levels. See other discussions too. Indigestion had started for me before the Taxotere, and onc put me on Nexium for it.
Posts.Title: Taxotere Side effects?

Posts.Content: I had 6 treatments of Epyrubicin (sp?), Cytoxin, and 5-FU, followed by 4 treatments of Taxotere. The anti-nausea drugs that were administered WITH the chemo worked very well, and I had no nausea at all. Taxotere continued to fatigue me, made my fingernails very hard during and for about 2 months after (and now they are weaker than before all this started).
Posts.Title: Taxotere Side effects?

Posts.Content: Had my port removed at time of 2nd (elective) mastectomy, with no problems. Downy facial hair will go away with normal face cleasing, etc. (At least, mine did) Congrats on finishing. Remember to give yourself time to recover, one day at a time.
Posts.Title: has any one had their portacatheter taken out
